title.raw: 《衛康叔世家》 House of Wei Kang Shu

sentences.zh: 衛康叔名封，周武王同母少弟也。

translations.literal: Wei Kang Shu, named Feng, was King Wu of Zhou's younger brother from the same mother.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Kang Shu, named Feng, was King Wu of Zhou's younger brother from the same mother.

sentences.zh: 其次尚有冉季，冉季最少。

translations.literal: Next there was still Ran Ji, who was the youngest.
translations.idiomatic: Next there was still Ran Ji, who was the youngest.

sentences.zh: 武王已克殷紂，復以殷餘民封紂子武庚祿父，比諸侯，以奉其先祀勿絕。

translations.literal: King Wu had already conquered Yin Zhou, and again enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu with Yin's remnant people, making him equal to the feudal lords, to continue their ancestor sacrifices without ending them.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already conquered Yin Zhou, and again enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lu Fu with Yin's remnant people, making him equal to the feudal lords; to continue their ancestor sacrifices without ending them.

sentences.zh: 為武庚未集，恐其有賊心，武王乃令其弟管叔、蔡叔傅相武庚祿父，以和其民。

translations.literal: Because Wu Geng had not yet gathered support, fearing he had treacherous intentions, King Wu then commanded his younger brothers Guan Shu and Cai Shu to tutor and assist Wu Geng Lu Fu, to harmonize their people.
translations.idiomatic: Because Wu Geng had not yet gathered support, fearing he had treacherous intentions, King Wu then commanded his younger brothers Guan Shu and Cai Shu to tutor and assist Wu Geng Lu Fu; to harmonize their people.

sentences.zh: 武王既崩，成王少。

translations.literal: King Wu had already passed away. King Cheng was young.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had already passed away; King Cheng was young.

sentences.zh: 周公旦代成王治，當國。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou Dan substituted for King Cheng in governing and held the state.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan substituted for King Cheng in governing and held the state.

sentences.zh: 管叔、蔡叔疑周公，乃與武庚祿父作亂，欲攻成周。

translations.literal: Guan Shu and Cai Shu doubted the Duke of Zhou, so they made rebellion with Wu Geng Lu Fu, desiring to attack Cheng Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and Cai Shu doubted the Duke of Zhou, so they made rebellion with Wu Geng Lu Fu; desiring to attack Cheng Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公旦以成王命興師伐殷，殺武庚祿父、管叔，放蔡叔，以武庚殷餘民封康叔為衛君，居河、淇閒故商墟。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou Dan, with King Cheng's command, raised troops to attack Yin, killed Wu Geng Lu Fu and Guan Shu, banished Cai Shu, and with Wu Geng's Yin remnant people enfeoffed Kang Shu as lord of Wei, residing between the He and Qi rivers in the former Shang ruins.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan, with King Cheng's command, raised troops to attack Yin; killed Wu Geng Lu Fu and Guan Shu; banished Cai Shu; and with Wu Geng's Yin remnant people enfeoffed Kang Shu as lord of Wei, residing between the He and Qi rivers in the former Shang ruins.

sentences.zh: 周公旦懼康叔齒少，乃申告康叔曰：「必求殷之賢人君子長者，問其先殷所以興，所以亡，而務愛民。」

translations.literal: Zhou Gong Dan feared Kang Shu teeth young, then repeatedly admonished Kang Shu said: 'Must seek Yin worthy people gentlemen elders, ask their former Yin why rose, why perished, and diligently love people.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou Dan feared Kang Shu was young, so he repeatedly admonished Kang Shu, saying: 'You must seek Yin's worthy people, gentlemen, and elders, ask them why their former Yin rose and why it perished, and diligently love the people.'

sentences.zh: 告以紂所以亡者以淫於酒，酒之失，婦人是用，故紂之亂自此始。

translations.literal: He admonished that Zhou perished because he was licentious with wine. Wine's harm was that women were employed, so Zhou's chaos began from this.
translations.idiomatic: He admonished that Zhou perished because he was licentious with wine; wine's harm was that women were employed; so Zhou's chaos began from this.

sentences.zh: 為梓材，示君子可法則。

translations.literal: He made the 'Zi Cai' to show gentlemen the rules they could model themselves after.
translations.idiomatic: He made the 'Zi Cai' to show gentlemen the rules they could model themselves after.

sentences.zh: 故謂之《康誥》、《酒誥》、《梓材》以命之。

translations.literal: Therefore called 'Kang Gao', 'Jiu Gao', 'Zi Cai' to command him.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they are called the 'Kang Gao', 'Jiu Gao', and 'Zi Cai' to command him.

sentences.zh: 康叔之國，既以此命，能和集其民，民大說。

translations.literal: Kang Shu went to his state. Already with this command, he could harmonize and gather his people, and the people were greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu went to his state; already with this command, he could harmonize and gather his people, and the people were greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 成王長，用事，舉康叔為周司寇，賜衛寶祭器，以章有德。

translations.literal: King Cheng grew up and handled affairs. He raised Kang Shu to be Zhou's Minister of Crime, granted Wei precious sacrificial vessels, to display his virtue.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng grew up and handled affairs; he raised Kang Shu to be Zhou's Minister of Crime; granted Wei precious sacrificial vessels; to display his virtue.

sentences.zh: 康叔卒，子康伯代立。

translations.literal: Kang Shu died, and his son Kang Bo replaced him.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Shu died; his son Kang Bo replaced him.

sentences.zh: 康伯卒，子考伯立。

translations.literal: Kang Bo died, and his son Kao Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Bo died; his son Kao Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 考伯卒，子嗣伯立。

translations.literal: Kao Bo died, and his son Si Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Kao Bo died; his son Si Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 嗣伯卒，子偼伯立。

translations.literal: Si Bo died, and his son You Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Si Bo died; his son You Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 偼伯卒，子靖伯立。

translations.literal: You Bo died, and his son Jing Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: You Bo died; his son Jing Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 靖伯卒，子貞伯立。

translations.literal: Jing Bo died, and his son Zhen Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Bo died; his son Zhen Bo ascended.

sentences.zh: 貞伯卒，子頃侯立。

translations.literal: Zhen Bo died, and his son Duke Qing ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Zhen Bo died; his son Duke Qing ascended.

sentences.zh: 頃侯厚賂周夷王，夷王命衛為侯。

translations.literal: Duke Qing thickly bribed King Yi of Zhou. King Yi commanded Wei to be a hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing thickly bribed King Yi of Zhou; King Yi commanded Wei to be a hou.

sentences.zh: 頃侯立十二年卒，子釐侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Qing ascended for twelve years and died. His son Duke Xi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing ascended for twelve years and died; his son Duke Xi ascended.

sentences.zh: 釐侯十三年，周厲王出奔于彘，共和行政焉。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's thirteenth year, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, and the Gong He administered government there.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's thirteenth year, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi; and the Gong He administered government there.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，周宣王立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，釐侯卒，太子共伯餘立為君。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Duke Xi died, and Crown Prince Gong Bo Yu ascended as lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Duke Xi died; and Crown Prince Gong Bo Yu ascended as lord.

sentences.zh: 共伯弟和有寵於釐侯，多予之賂；

translations.literal: Gong Bo younger brother He had favor with Xi Hou, much gave him bribes;
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo's younger brother He had favor with Duke Xi, who gave him many bribes;

sentences.zh: 和以其賂賂士，以襲攻共伯於墓上，共伯入釐侯羨自殺。

translations.literal: He used his bribes to bribe warriors, to suddenly attack Gong Bo at the tomb above. Gong Bo entered Duke Xi's pavilion and committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He used his bribes to bribe warriors; to suddenly attack Gong Bo at the tomb above. Gong Bo entered Duke Xi's pavilion and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 衛人因葬之釐侯旁，謚曰共伯，而立和為衛侯，是為武公。

translations.literal: The Wei people therefore buried him beside Duke Xi, gave him the posthumous name Gong Bo, and established He as Wei's hou, who became Duke Wu.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei people therefore buried him beside Duke Xi; gave him the posthumous name Gong Bo; and established He as Wei's hou, who became Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公即位，修康叔之政，百姓和集。

translations.literal: Duke Wu ascended the throne and repaired Kang Shu's policies. The people were harmonious and gathered together.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu ascended the throne and repaired Kang Shu's policies; the people were harmonious and gathered together.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，犬戎殺周幽王，武公將兵往佐周平戎，甚有功，周平王命武公為公。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, the Quan Rong killed King You of Zhou. Duke Wu led troops to assist Zhou in pacifying the Rong, and had great merit. King Ping of Zhou commanded Duke Wu to be a gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, the Quan Rong killed King You of Zhou; Duke Wu led troops to assist Zhou in pacifying the Rong, and had great merit; King Ping of Zhou commanded Duke Wu to be a gong.

sentences.zh: 五十五年，卒，子莊公揚立。

translations.literal: In the fifty-fifth year, he died, and his son Duke Zhuang Yang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fifth year, he died; and his son Duke Zhuang Yang ascended.

sentences.zh: 莊公五年，取齊女為夫人，好而無子。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, he took a Qi woman as his wife. He loved her but she had no son.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, he took a Qi woman as his wife; he loved her but she had no son.

sentences.zh: 又取陳女為夫人，生子，蚤死。

translations.literal: He again took a Chen woman as his wife. She gave birth to a son, but he died early.
translations.idiomatic: He again took a woman from Chen as his wife. She bore him a son, but the child died young.

sentences.zh: 陳女女弟亦幸於莊公，而生子完。

translations.literal: The Chen woman's younger sister was also favored by Duke Zhuang, and gave birth to a son named Wan.
translations.idiomatic: The younger sister of the Chen woman was also favored by Duke Zhuang and bore him a son named Wan.

sentences.zh: 完母死，莊公令夫人齊女子之，立為太子。

translations.literal: Wan's mother died. Duke Zhuang commanded his wife, the Qi woman, to raise him and established him as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: When Wan's mother died, Duke Zhuang commanded his wife—the woman from Qi—to raise him and established him as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 莊公有寵妾，生子州吁。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang had a favored concubine who gave birth to a son named Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had a favored concubine who bore him a son named Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 十八年，州吁長，好兵，莊公使將。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Zhou Xu had grown up. He liked war, and Duke Zhuang made him a general.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Zhou Xu came of age. He was fond of military affairs, so Duke Zhuang appointed him as a general.

sentences.zh: 石碏諫莊公曰：「庶子好兵，使將，亂自此起。」

translations.literal: Shi Que admonished Zhuang Gong said: 'Concubine's son likes war, makes him general, chaos from this arises.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Que admonished Duke Zhuang, saying: 'The concubine's son likes war. Making him a general—chaos will arise from this.'

sentences.zh: 不聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He refused to listen.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊公卒，太子完立，是為桓公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang died, and Crown Prince Wan ascended, who became Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang died, and Crown Prince Wan ascended the throne, becoming Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公二年，弟州吁驕奢，桓公絀之，州吁出奔。

translations.literal: In Duke Huan's second year, his younger brother Zhou Xu was arrogant and extravagant. Duke Huan demoted him, and Zhou Xu fled.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan's second year, his younger brother Zhou Xu became arrogant and extravagant. Duke Huan demoted him, and Zhou Xu fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 十三年，鄭伯弟段攻其兄，不勝，亡，而州吁求與之友。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Zheng Bo's younger brother Duan attacked his elder brother, was not victorious, fled, and Zhou Xu sought to befriend him.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, the younger brother of the Lord of Zheng, Duan, attacked his elder brother but failed. Duan fled, and Zhou Xu sought to befriend him.

sentences.zh: 十六年，州吁收聚衛亡人以襲殺桓公，州吁自立為衛君。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Zhou Xu gathered Wei fugitives to suddenly kill Duke Huan, and Zhou Xu self-established as Wei's lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Zhou Xu gathered Wei refugees and used them to assassinate Duke Huan. Zhou Xu then established himself as Lord of Wei.

sentences.zh: 為鄭伯弟段欲伐鄭，請宋、陳、蔡與俱，三國皆許州吁。

translations.literal: For Zheng Bo's younger brother Duan who desired to attack Zheng, he requested Song, Chen, and Cai to go with him. The three states all promised Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: To help Duan—the younger brother of the Lord of Zheng—who wished to attack Zheng, Zhou Xu requested that Song, Chen, and Cai join him. All three states agreed to support Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 州吁新立，好兵，弒桓公，衛人皆不愛。

translations.literal: Zhou Xu was newly established, liked war, assassinated Duke Huan—the Wei people all did not love him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Xu had only recently taken power. He was fond of military affairs and had assassinated Duke Huan. The people of Wei all despised him.

sentences.zh: 石碏乃因桓公母家於陳，詳為善州吁。

translations.literal: Shi Que then used Duke Huan's mother's family in Chen and pretended to be good to Zhou Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Que then used Duke Huan's maternal family in Chen as intermediaries and feigned goodwill toward Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 至鄭郊，石碏與陳侯共謀，使右宰丑進食，因殺州吁于濮，而迎桓公弟晉於邢而立之，是為宣公。

translations.literal: They arrived at Zheng's outskirts. Shi Que plotted together with the Chen hou, had the right prime minister Chou advance food, and took advantage to kill Zhou Xu at Pu. They welcomed Duke Huan's younger brother Jin from Xing and established him, who became Duke Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: When they reached the outskirts of Zheng, Shi Que plotted with the Marquis of Chen. They had the Right Steward Chou present food as a pretext to kill Zhou Xu at Pu. They then welcomed Duke Huan's younger brother Jin from Xing and installed him as ruler, who became Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公七年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In Duke Xuan's seventh year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's seventh year, the state of Lu assassinated their ruler, Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 九年，宋督弒其君殤公，及孔父。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Song's Du assassinated their lord Duke Shang, and Kong Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Du of Song assassinated his ruler Duke Shang, along with Kong Fu.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉曲沃莊伯弒其君哀侯。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Jin's Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated their lord Duke Ai.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhuang Bo of Quwo in Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 十八年，初，宣公愛夫人夷姜，夷姜生子伋，以為太子，而令右公子傅之。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, initially Duke Xuan loved his wife Yi Jiang. Yi Jiang gave birth to a son named Ji, made him crown prince, and commanded the right prince to tutor him.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year: Duke Xuan initially loved his wife Yi Jiang. She bore him a son named Ji, whom he made crown prince, and he commanded the Right Prince to tutor him.

sentences.zh: 右公子為太子取齊女，未入室，而宣公見所欲為太子婦者好，說而自取之，更為太子取他女。

translations.literal: The right prince took a Qi woman for the crown prince. She had not yet entered the chamber, but Duke Xuan saw that the one desired to be the crown prince's wife was good, was pleased and took her himself, and changed to take another woman for the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The Right Prince took a woman from Qi for the crown prince. She had not yet entered the prince's quarters when Duke Xuan saw that the woman intended for the crown prince was beautiful. He was pleased and took her for himself, then arranged another woman for the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 宣公得齊女，生子壽、子朔，令左公子傅之。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan got the Qi woman and she gave birth to sons Shou and Shuo. He commanded the left prince to tutor them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan took the woman from Qi, and she bore him two sons: Shou and Shuo. He commanded the Left Prince to tutor them.

sentences.zh: 太子伋母死，宣公正夫人與朔共讒惡太子伋。

translations.literal: Crown Prince Ji's mother died. Duke Xuan's proper wife together with Shuo slandered and hated Crown Prince Ji.
translations.idiomatic: When Crown Prince Ji's mother died, Duke Xuan's principal wife joined with Shuo to slander and despise Crown Prince Ji.

sentences.zh: 宣公自以其奪太子妻也，心惡太子，欲廢之。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan himself, because he had seized the crown prince's wife, hated the crown prince in his heart and desired to depose him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan himself felt guilty for having taken the crown prince's wife, and so he came to hate the crown prince and wished to depose him.

sentences.zh: 及聞其惡，大怒，乃使太子伋於齊而令盜遮界上殺之，與太子白旄，而告界盜見持白旄者殺之。

translations.literal: And when he heard their slander, he was greatly angered. He then sent Crown Prince Ji to Qi and commanded robbers to block him at the border and kill him. He gave the crown prince a white banner, and told the border robbers to kill whoever held the white banner.
translations.idiomatic: When he heard this slander, he flew into a great rage. He sent Crown Prince Ji to Qi but commanded bandits to ambush and kill him at the border. He gave the crown prince a white banner as a token, and instructed the border bandits to kill whoever carried the white banner.

sentences.zh: 且行，子朔之兄壽，太子異母弟也，知朔之惡太子而君欲殺之，乃謂太子曰：「界盜見太子白旄，即殺太子，太子可毋行。」

translations.literal: About to go, Zi Shuo's elder brother Shou, crown prince different mother younger brother, knew Shuo hated crown prince and lord desired kill him, then told crown prince said: 'Border robbers see crown prince white banner, immediately kill crown prince, crown prince can not go.'
translations.idiomatic: About to go, Zi Shuo's elder brother Shou— the crown prince's half-brother from a different mother—knew that Shuo hated the crown prince and the lord desired to kill him. He then told the crown prince, saying: 'The border robbers will see the crown prince's white banner and immediately kill the crown prince. The crown prince can choose not to go.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「逆父命求生，不可。」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Go against father command seek life, not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'To go against my father's command and seek life is not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 遂行。

translations.literal: He then went.
translations.idiomatic: So he departed.

sentences.zh: 壽見太子不止，乃盜其白旄而先馳至界。

translations.literal: Shou saw that the crown prince would not stop, so he stole his white banner and galloped first to the border.
translations.idiomatic: Shou saw that the crown prince would not halt his journey, so he stole the white banner from him and galloped ahead to the border.

sentences.zh: 界盜見其驗，即殺之。

translations.literal: The border robbers saw the token and immediately killed him.
translations.idiomatic: The border bandits saw the token and immediately killed him.

sentences.zh: 壽已死，而太子伋又至，謂盜曰：「所當殺乃我也。」

translations.literal: Shou already dead, and crown prince Ji again arrived, told robbers said: 'What should be killed is me.'
translations.idiomatic: Shou was already dead, and Crown Prince Ji arrived again. He told the robbers, saying: 'The one who should be killed is me.'

sentences.zh: 盜并殺太子伋，以報宣公。

translations.literal: The robbers together killed Crown Prince Ji, to report to Duke Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: The bandits then also killed Crown Prince Ji to report back to Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公乃以子朔為太子。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan then made Zi Shuo the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan then made Shuo his crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十九年，宣公卒，太子朔立，是為惠公。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Duke Xuan died, and Crown Prince Shuo ascended, who became Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Xuan died, and Crown Prince Shuo ascended the throne, becoming Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 左右公子不平朔之立也，惠公四年，左右公子怨惠公之讒殺前太子伋而代立，乃作亂，攻惠公，立太子伋之弟黔牟為君，惠公奔齊。

translations.literal: The left and right princes were not content with Shuo's establishment. In Duke Hui's fourth year, the left and right princes resented Duke Hui for slandering and killing the previous Crown Prince Ji to replace him. They then made rebellion, attacked Duke Hui, established Crown Prince Ji's younger brother Qian Mou as lord, and Duke Hui fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The Left and Right Princes were discontented with Shuo's installation as heir. In Duke Hui's fourth year, they resented Duke Hui for having slandered and murdered the previous Crown Prince Ji to take his place. They rebelled, attacked Duke Hui, installed Crown Prince Ji's younger brother Qian Mou as ruler, and Duke Hui fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 衛君黔牟立八年，齊襄公率諸侯奉王命共伐衛，納衛惠公，誅左右公子。

translations.literal: Wei lord Qian Mou ascended for eight years. Duke Xiang of Qi led the feudal lords who received the wang's command to together attack Wei, received Duke Hui of Wei, and executed the left and right princes.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Qian Mou of Wei reigned for eight years. Duke Xiang of Qi led the feudal lords, acting on the king's command, in a united attack on Wei. They restored Duke Hui of Wei and executed the Left and Right Princes.

sentences.zh: 衛君黔牟奔于周，惠公復立。

translations.literal: Wei lord Qian Mou fled to Zhou, and Duke Hui ascended again.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Qian Mou of Wei fled to Zhou, and Duke Hui was restored to the throne.

sentences.zh: 惠公立三年出亡，亡八年復入，與前通年凡十三年矣。

translations.literal: Duke Hui ascended for three years and went into exile. He was exiled for eight years and entered again. With the previous continuous years, altogether thirteen years.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui reigned for three years before going into exile. He remained in exile for eight years before returning. Counting the previous continuous years, this made thirteen years in total.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，惠公怨周之容舍黔牟，與燕伐周。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Hui resented Zhou for harboring Qian Mou, and with Yan attacked Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Hui resented Zhou for sheltering Qian Mou, and joined with Yan to attack Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周惠王奔溫，衛、燕立惠王弟穨為王。

translations.literal: King Hui of Zhou fled to Wen. Wei and Yan established King Hui's younger brother Kui as wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Zhou fled to Wen. Wei and Yan installed King Hui's younger brother Kui as king.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，鄭復納惠王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Zheng again received King Hui.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Zheng restored King Hui to the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，惠公卒，子懿公赤立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Yi Chi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Duke Hui died, and his son Chi ascended as Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 懿公即位，好鶴，淫樂奢侈。

translations.literal: Duke Yi ascended the throne. He liked cranes and was licentious, pleasure-loving, and extravagant.
translations.idiomatic: Upon ascending the throne, Duke Yi developed a fondness for cranes and indulged in licentious pleasures and extravagance.

sentences.zh: 九年，翟伐衛，衛懿公欲發兵，兵或畔。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, the Di attacked Wei. Duke Yi of Wei desired to raise troops, but some of the troops rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, the Di attacked Wei. Duke Yi of Wei wanted to mobilize troops, but some of his soldiers rebelled.

sentences.zh: 大臣言曰：「君好鶴，鶴可令擊翟。」

translations.literal: Grand ministers said: 'Lord likes cranes, cranes can be commanded to strike Di.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand ministers said: 'The lord likes cranes. The cranes can be commanded to strike the Di.'

sentences.zh: 翟於是遂入，殺懿公。

translations.literal: The Di therefore then entered and killed Duke Yi.
translations.idiomatic: The Di then entered Wei and killed Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 懿公之立也，百姓大臣皆不服。

translations.literal: When Duke Yi was established, the common people and grand ministers all did not submit.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Yi ascended the throne, neither the common people nor the high ministers submitted to him.

sentences.zh: 自懿公父惠公朔之讒殺太子伋代立至於懿公，常欲敗之，卒滅惠公之後而更立黔牟之弟昭伯頑之子申為君，是為戴公。

translations.literal: From Duke Yi's father Duke Hui Shuo who slandered and killed Crown Prince Ji to replace him, until Duke Yi, they often desired to overthrow them. They finally extinguished Duke Hui's descendants and changed to establish Qian Mou's younger brother Zhao Bo Wan's son Shen as lord, who became Duke Dai.
translations.idiomatic: From Duke Yi's father Duke Hui Shuo—who had slandered and murdered Crown Prince Ji to usurp his position—down to Duke Yi himself, they constantly sought to overthrow the legitimate line. In the end, they extinguished Duke Hui's descendants and installed Shen, son of Zhao Bo Wan (younger brother of Qian Mou), as ruler. He became Duke Dai.

sentences.zh: 戴公申元年卒。

translations.literal: Duke Dai Shen died in his first year.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dai Shen died in his first year of rule.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公以衛數亂，乃率諸侯伐翟，為衛筑楚丘，立戴公弟燬為衛君，是為文公。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi, because Wei was frequently in chaos, then led the feudal lords to attack the Di. For Wei he built Chu Qiu and established Duke Dai's younger brother Hui as Wei's lord, who became Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Because Wei suffered frequent disorders, Duke Huan of Qi led the feudal lords to attack the Di. For Wei, he built the city of Chuqiu and installed Hui, Duke Dai's younger brother, as Lord of Wei. He became Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公以亂故奔齊，齊人入之。

translations.literal: Duke Wen, because of the chaos, fled to Qi, and the Qi people brought him in.
translations.idiomatic: Due to the chaos, Duke Wen fled to Qi, and the people of Qi welcomed him.

sentences.zh: 初，翟殺懿公也，衛人憐之，思復立宣公前死太子伋之後，伋子又死，而代伋死者子壽又無子。

translations.literal: Initially, when the Di killed Duke Yi, the Wei people pitied him and thought to again establish Duke Xuan's previously deceased Crown Prince Ji's descendants. Ji's son had also died, and the one who died in Ji's place, Shou, also had no son.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when the Di killed Duke Yi, the people of Wei took pity on him and considered restoring the line of Crown Prince Ji—the son of Duke Xuan who had died earlier. But Ji's own son had also died, and Shou—who died in Ji's stead—likewise had no descendants.

sentences.zh: 太子伋同母弟二人：其一曰黔牟，黔牟嘗代惠公為君，八年復去；

translations.literal: Crown prince Ji same mother younger brothers two: one called Qian Mou, Qian Mou once replaced Hui Gong as lord, eight years again left;
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Ji had two same-mother younger brothers: one named Qian Mou. Qian Mou once replaced Duke Hui as lord for eight years, then left again;

sentences.zh: 其二曰昭伯。

translations.literal: The second was called Zhao Bo.
translations.idiomatic: The second was called Zhao Bo.

sentences.zh: 昭伯、黔牟皆已前死，故立昭伯子申為戴公。

translations.literal: Zhao Bo and Qian Mou had both already died previously, so they established Zhao Bo's son Shen as Duke Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Since both Zhao Bo and Qian Mou had already died, they installed Zhao Bo's son Shen as Duke Dai.

sentences.zh: 戴公卒，復立其弟燬為文公。

translations.literal: Duke Dai died, and they again established his younger brother Hui as Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Dai died, they installed his younger brother Hui as Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公初立，輕賦平罪，身自勞，與百姓同苦，以收衛民。

translations.literal: Duke Wen was first established. He lightened taxes and equalized punishments, labored with his own body, shared the same bitterness with the common people, to gather the Wei people.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen first took the throne, he lightened taxes and equalized punishments. He labored personally and shared the people's hardships to win the allegiance of the Wei populace.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉公子重耳過，無禮。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Jin's Prince Chong Er passed through, without proper ritual.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Prince Chong Er of Jin passed through Wei without observing proper ritual.

sentences.zh: 十七年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，文公卒，子成公鄭立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and his son Duke Cheng Zheng ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and his son Zheng ascended as Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成公三年，晉欲假道於衛救宋，成公不許。

translations.literal: In Duke Cheng's third year, Jin desired to borrow a road through Wei to save Song, but Duke Cheng did not permit it.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Cheng's third year, Jin requested passage through Wei to rescue Song, but Duke Cheng refused.

sentences.zh: 晉更從南河度，救宋。

translations.literal: Jin changed and crossed from the south river to save Song.
translations.idiomatic: Jin changed course and crossed the Yellow River from the south to rescue Song.

sentences.zh: 徵師於衛，衛大夫欲許，成公不肯。

translations.literal: They summoned troops from Wei. Wei's grand officers desired to permit it, but Duke Cheng was not willing.
translations.idiomatic: They requested troops from Wei. Wei's high ministers wished to comply, but Duke Cheng refused.

sentences.zh: 大夫元咺攻成公，成公出奔。

translations.literal: Grand officer Yuan Tiao attacked Duke Cheng, and Duke Cheng fled.
translations.idiomatic: The high minister Yuan Xu attacked Duke Cheng, who fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 晉文公重耳伐衛，分其地予宋，討前過無禮及不救宋患也。

translations.literal: Duke Wen of Jin Chong Er attacked Wei, divided its land and gave it to Song, punishing the previous passing without ritual and not saving Song's calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen of Jin (Chong Er) attacked Wei, divided its territory and awarded it to Song, punishing Wei for the previous affront of showing him no ritual courtesy and for failing to rescue Song in its distress.

sentences.zh: 衛成公遂出奔陳。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng of Wei then fled to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Cheng of Wei then fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 二歲，如周求入，與晉文公會。

translations.literal: After two years, he went to Zhou to seek entry and assembled with Duke Wen of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: After two years, he traveled to Zhou to request restoration and met with Duke Wen of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉使人鴆衛成公，成公私於周主鴆，令薄，得不死。

translations.literal: Jin had people poison Duke Cheng of Wei. Duke Cheng privately bribed Zhou's poison lord and commanded it to be thin, so he obtained not dying.
translations.idiomatic: Jin sent agents to poison Duke Cheng of Wei. Duke Cheng secretly bribed the Zhou official overseeing the poison and had him weaken it, thus escaping death.

sentences.zh: 已而周為請晉文公，卒入之衛，而誅元咺，衛君瑕出奔。

translations.literal: Then Zhou requested on his behalf to Duke Wen of Jin. He finally entered Wei, and executed Yuan Tiao. Wei lord Xia fled.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, Zhou interceded with Duke Wen of Jin on his behalf. Duke Cheng was finally restored to Wei, where he executed Yuan Xu. Lord Xia of Wei fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉文公卒。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Duke Wen of Jin died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 十二年，成公朝晉襄公。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Duke Cheng paid court to Duke Xiang of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Duke Cheng paid homage to Duke Xiang of Jin.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Duke Mu of Qin died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊邴歜弒其君懿公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi's Bing Chan assassinated their lord Duke Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Bing Chan of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，成公卒，子穆公遫立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Duke Cheng died, and his son Duke Mu Suo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Duke Cheng died, and his son Suo ascended as Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆公二年，楚莊王伐陳，殺夏徵舒。

translations.literal: In Duke Mu's second year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked Chen and killed Xia Zheng Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Mu's second year, King Zhuang of Chu attacked Chen and executed Xia Zhengshu.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王圍鄭，鄭降，復釋之。

translations.literal: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu surrounded Zheng. Zheng surrendered, and he again freed them.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu besieged Zheng. Zheng surrendered, but he released them once more.

sentences.zh: 十一年，孫良夫救魯伐齊，復得侵地。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Sun Liang Fu saved Lu and attacked Qi, again obtaining the invaded land.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Sun Liangfu came to Lu's rescue by attacking Qi, and regained the territory that had been seized.

sentences.zh: 穆公卒，子定公臧立。

translations.literal: Duke Mu died, and his son Duke Ding Zang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu died, and his son Zang ascended as Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 定公十二年卒，子獻公衎立。

translations.literal: Duke Ding died in his twelfth year, and his son Duke Xian Kan ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding died in his twelfth year, and his son Kan ascended as Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公十三年，公令師曹教宮妾鼓琴，妾不善，曹笞之。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's thirteenth year, the duke commanded Teacher Cao to teach the palace concubine to play the zither. The concubine was not good, and Cao whipped her.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's thirteenth year, the duke ordered Master Cao to teach a palace concubine to play the zither. The concubine was unskilled, so Cao whipped her.

sentences.zh: 妾以幸惡曹於公，公亦笞曹三百。

translations.literal: The concubine, with favor, hated Cao to the duke. The duke also whipped Cao three hundred times.
translations.idiomatic: Taking advantage of her favored position, the concubine spoke ill of Cao to the duke. The duke then had Cao whipped three hundred lashes.

sentences.zh: 十八年，獻公戒孫文子、甯惠子食，皆往。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xian summoned Sun Wen Zi and Ning Hui Zi to eat, and they all went.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xian invited Sun Wenzi and Ning Huizi to a banquet, and they both attended.

sentences.zh: 日旰不召，而去射鴻於囿。

translations.literal: The day grew late without summons, and they went to shoot geese in the park.
translations.idiomatic: As the day grew late without any summons, they departed to hunt geese in the park.

sentences.zh: 二子從之，公不釋射服與之言。

translations.literal: The two sons followed him. The duke did not remove his hunting clothes and spoke with them.
translations.idiomatic: The two sons followed him. Without removing his hunting attire, the duke spoke with them.

sentences.zh: 二子怒，如宿。

translations.literal: The two sons were angered and went to Su.
translations.idiomatic: The two sons grew angry and went to Su.

sentences.zh: 孫文子子數侍公飲，使師曹歌巧言之卒章。

translations.literal: Sun Wen Zi's son often served the duke drinks and made Shi Cao sing the final stanza of clever words.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Wenzi's son frequently attended the duke at banquets and had Master Cao sing the concluding stanza of a song about clever words.

sentences.zh: 師曹又怒公之嘗笞三百，乃歌之，欲以怒孫文子，報衛獻公。

translations.literal: Shi Cao was also angered that the duke had once whipped him three hundred times. He then sang it, desiring to anger Sun Wen Zi and repay Duke Xian of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Master Cao, still resentful that the duke had once whipped him three hundred lashes, sang the song in turn, hoping to anger Sun Wenzi and avenge himself on Duke Xian of Wei.

sentences.zh: 文子語蘧伯玉，伯玉曰：「臣不知也。」

translations.literal: Wen Zi told Qu Bo Yu, Bo Yu said: 'Minister not know.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zi told Qu Bo Yu. Bo Yu said: 'This minister does not know.'

sentences.zh: 遂攻出獻公。

translations.literal: They then attacked and expelled Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: They then attacked and drove out Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公奔齊，齊置衛獻公於聚邑。

translations.literal: Duke Xian fled to Qi. Qi placed Duke Xian of Wei at Ju yi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian fled to Qi, where the Qi court settled him in the town of Ju.

sentences.zh: 孫文子、甯惠子共立定公弟秋為衛君，是為殤公。

translations.literal: Sun Wen Zi and Ning Hui Zi together established Duke Ding's younger brother Qiu as Wei's lord, who became Duke Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Wenzi and Ning Huizi jointly installed Qiu, Duke Ding's younger brother, as Lord of Wei. He became Duke Shang.

sentences.zh: 殤公秋立，封孫文子林父於宿。

translations.literal: Duke Shang Qiu ascended and enfeoffed Sun Wen Zi Lin Fu at Su.
translations.idiomatic: Upon ascending the throne, Duke Shang Qiu enfeoffed Lin Fu (Sun Wenzi) with the town of Su.

sentences.zh: 十二年，甯喜與孫林父爭寵相惡，殤公使甯喜攻孫林父。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Ning Xi and Sun Lin Fu contended for favor and mutually hated each other. Duke Shang made Ning Xi attack Sun Lin Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Ning Xi and Sun Lin Fu vied for favor and came to despise each other. Duke Shang ordered Ning Xi to attack Sun Lin Fu.

sentences.zh: 林父奔晉，復求入故衛獻公。

translations.literal: Lin Fu fled to Jin and again sought to enter the former Duke Xian of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Lin Fu fled to Jin and once more petitioned for the restoration of the former Duke Xian of Wei.

sentences.zh: 獻公在齊，齊景公聞之，與衛獻公如晉求入。

translations.literal: Duke Xian was in Qi. Duke Jing of Qi heard of it and with Duke Xian of Wei went to Jin to seek entry.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian was residing in Qi. When Duke Jing of Qi learned of this, he accompanied Duke Xian of Wei to Jin to petition for his restoration.

sentences.zh: 晉為伐衛，誘與盟。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Wei on his behalf and lured them with an alliance.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Wei on his behalf and enticed them into an alliance.

sentences.zh: 衛殤公會晉平公，平公執殤公與甯喜而復入衛獻公。

translations.literal: Duke Shang of Wei assembled with Duke Ping of Jin. Duke Ping seized Duke Shang and Ning Xi and again entered Duke Xian of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shang of Wei met with Duke Ping of Jin. Duke Ping seized Duke Shang and Ning Xi, then restored Duke Xian of Wei to power.

sentences.zh: 獻公亡在外十二年而入。

translations.literal: Duke Xian, who had fled outside for twelve years, then entered.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian, who had been in exile for twelve years, then returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 獻公後元年，誅甯喜。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's first year after returning, he executed Ning Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's first year after his restoration, he executed Ning Xi.

sentences.zh: 三年，吳延陵季子使過衛，見蘧伯玉、史，曰：「衛多君子，其國無故。」

translations.literal: Third year, Wu Yanling Ji Zi envoy passed Wei, saw Qu Bo Yu, Shi, said: 'Wei has many noblemen, their state without calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Wu's Yanling Ji Zi, on an envoy mission, passed through Wei. He saw Qu Bo Yu and Shi, and said: 'Wei has many noblemen. Their state will be without calamity.'

sentences.zh: 過宿，孫林父為擊磬，曰：「不樂，音大悲，使衛亂乃此矣。」

translations.literal: Passed Su, Sun Lin Fu for struck qing, said: 'Not happy, sound greatly sad, make Wei chaos this will be it.'
translations.idiomatic: He passed through Su. Sun Lin Fu struck the qing for him and said: 'Not happy. The sound is greatly sad. The cause of Wei's chaos will be this.'

sentences.zh: 是年，獻公卒，子襄公惡立。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Xian died, and his son Duke Xiang Wu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Duke Xian died, and his son Wu ascended as Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 襄公六年，楚靈王會諸侯，襄公稱病不往。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiang's sixth year, King Ling of Chu assembled the feudal lords. Duke Xiang claimed illness and did not go.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's sixth year, King Ling of Chu convened the feudal lords. Duke Xiang pleaded illness and declined to attend.

sentences.zh: 九年，襄公卒。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Duke Xiang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Xiang died.

sentences.zh: 初，襄公有賤妾，幸之，有身，夢有人謂曰：「我康叔也，令若子必有衛，名而子曰『元』。」

translations.literal: Beginning, Xiang Gong had lowly concubine, favored her, had body, dreamed someone told said: 'I Kang Shu, make your son must have Wei, name your son 'Yuan'.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Xiang had a lowly concubine whom he favored. She became pregnant and dreamed that someone told her: 'I am Kang Shu. Make sure your son will have Wei. Name your son 'Yuan'.'

sentences.zh: 妾怪之，問孔成子。

translations.literal: The concubine was astonished and asked Kong Cheng Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The concubine was astonished and inquired of Kong Chengzi.

sentences.zh: 成子曰：「康叔者，衛祖也。」

translations.literal: Cheng Zi said: 'Kang Shu was Wei ancestor.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi said: 'Kang Shu is Wei's ancestor.'

sentences.zh: 及生子，男也，以告襄公。

translations.literal: And she gave birth to a son, a male. She told Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: When she gave birth to a son, she informed Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 襄公曰：「天所置也。」

translations.literal: Xiang Gong said: 'Heaven placed it.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang said: 'Heaven has placed it.'

sentences.zh: 名之曰元。

translations.literal: They named him Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: They named him Yuan.

sentences.zh: 襄公夫人無子，於是乃立元為嗣，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang's wife had no son. They then established Yuan as the heir, who became Duke Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Since Duke Xiang's principal wife had borne no son, they established Yuan as heir. He became Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 四十二年春，靈公游于郊，令子郢仆。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year spring, Duke Ling toured the suburbs and commanded Zi Ying to drive the chariot.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the forty-second year, Duke Ling went on an excursion to the suburbs and ordered Zi Ying to drive his chariot.

sentences.zh: 郢，靈公少子也，字子南。

translations.literal: Ying was Duke Ling's youngest son, with the courtesy name Zi Nan.
translations.idiomatic: Ying was Duke Ling's youngest son, styled Zi Nan.

sentences.zh: 靈公怨太子出奔，謂郢曰：「我將立若為後。」

translations.literal: Ling Gong resented crown prince fled, told Ying said: 'I will establish you as successor.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling resented the crown prince's flight and told Ying: 'I will establish you as my successor.'

sentences.zh: 郢對曰：「郢不足以辱社稷，君更圖之。」

translations.literal: Ying replied said: 'Ying not sufficient to disgrace altars of soil and grain, lord further plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: Ying replied: 'Ying is not sufficient to disgrace the altars of soil and grain. My lord, please plan further.'

sentences.zh: 夏，靈公卒，夫人命子郢為太子，曰：「此靈公命也。」

translations.literal: Summer, Ling Gong died, wife commanded Zi Ying as crown prince, said: 'This Ling Gong command.'
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Ling died. His wife commanded Zi Ying to be crown prince, saying: 'This is Duke Ling's command.'

sentences.zh: 郢曰：「亡人太子蒯聵之子輒在也，不敢當。」

translations.literal: Ying said: 'Exiled crown prince Kuai Kui son Zhe here, dare not accept.'
translations.idiomatic: Ying said: 'The exiled crown prince Kuai Kui's son Zhe is here. I dare not accept.'

sentences.zh: 於是衛乃以輒為君，是為出公。

translations.literal: Then Wei established Zhe as lord, who became Duke Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Wei then installed Zhe as their ruler. He became Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月乙酉，趙簡子欲入蒯聵，乃令陽虎詐命衛十餘人衰绖歸，簡子送蒯聵。

translations.literal: In the sixth month, Yi You, Zhao Jian Zi desired to enter Kuai Kui. He then commanded Yang Hu to falsely command over ten Wei people in mourning hemp to return. Jian Zi sent Kuai Kui.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yi You day of the sixth month, Zhao Jianzi wished to restore Kuai Kui to power. He ordered Yang Hu to forge a command summoning more than ten Wei nobles, dressed in mourning hemp, to return home. Jianzi then escorted Kuai Kui back.

sentences.zh: 衛人聞之，發兵擊蒯聵。

translations.literal: The Wei people heard of it and raised troops to attack Kuai Kui.
translations.idiomatic: When the Wei people learned of this, they mobilized troops to attack Kuai Kui.

sentences.zh: 蒯聵不得入，入宿而保，衛人亦罷兵。

translations.literal: Kuai Kui could not enter. He entered Su and defended it. The Wei people also stopped their troops.
translations.idiomatic: Unable to enter Wei, Kuai Kui took refuge in Su and fortified it. The Wei forces also stood down.

sentences.zh: 出公輒四年，齊田乞弒其君孺子。

translations.literal: In Duke Chu Zhe's fourth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated their lord Duke Ru.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Chu Zhe's fourth year, Tian Qi of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Ru.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊鮑子弒其君悼公。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qi's Bao Zi assassinated their lord Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Bao Zi of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 孔子自陳入衛。

translations.literal: Kong Qiu entered Wei from Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius traveled from Chen to Wei.

sentences.zh: 九年，孔文子問兵於仲尼，仲尼不對。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Kong Wen Zi asked about warfare from Zhong Ni. Zhong Ni did not answer.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Kong Wenzi asked Zhong Ni about military matters, but Zhong Ni refused to answer.

sentences.zh: 其後魯迎仲尼，仲尼反魯。

translations.literal: After that, Lu welcomed Zhong Ni, and Zhong Ni returned to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Later, Lu invited Zhong Ni to return, and he went back to Lu.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初，孔圉文子取太子蒯聵之姊，生悝。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, initially Kong Yu Wen Zi took the crown prince Kuai Kui's sister and gave birth to Pei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year: Kong Yu (Wen Zi) had initially married Crown Prince Kuai Kui's sister, who bore him a son named Pei.

sentences.zh: 孔氏之豎渾良夫美好，孔文子卒，良夫通於悝母。

translations.literal: The Kong clan's attendant Hun Liang Fu was beautiful and good. Kong Wen Zi died, and Liang Fu had relations with Pei's mother.
translations.idiomatic: Hun Liangfu, a handsome servant in the Kong household, had an affair with Pei's mother after Kong Wenzi died.

sentences.zh: 太子在宿，悝母使良夫於太子。

translations.literal: The crown prince was in Su. Pei's mother sent Liang Fu to the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince was residing in Su. Pei's mother sent Liangfu to contact him.

sentences.zh: 太子與良夫言曰：「茍能入我國，報子以乘軒，免子三死，毋所與。」

translations.literal: Crown prince with Liang Fu spoke said: 'If able enter my state, repay you with riding xuan, exempt you three deaths, nothing not give.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince spoke with Liang Fu, saying: 'If you can enter my state, I will repay you with riding in a xuan chariot, exempt you from three deaths, and give you everything.'

sentences.zh: 與之盟，許以悝母為妻。

translations.literal: He made an alliance with him and promised Pei's mother as his wife.
translations.idiomatic: He formed an alliance with the crown prince and promised him Pei's mother as his wife.

sentences.zh: 閏月，良夫與太子入，舍孔氏之外圃。

translations.literal: In the leap month, Liang Fu entered with the crown prince and resided in the Kong clan's outer garden.
translations.idiomatic: In the intercalary month, Liangfu entered Wei with the crown prince and took up residence in the Kong family's outer garden.

sentences.zh: 昏，二人蒙衣而乘，宦者羅御，如孔氏。

translations.literal: At dusk, the two people covered their clothes and rode. The eunuch Luo drove, and they went to the Kong clan.
translations.idiomatic: At dusk, the two men disguised themselves by covering their clothes and rode out. The eunuch Luo drove their chariot to the Kong residence.

sentences.zh: 孔氏之老欒甯問之，稱姻妾以告。

translations.literal: The Kong clan's elder Luan Ning asked him, and he called the marriage concubine to tell him.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Ning, an elder of the Kong clan, questioned him, and he claimed he was there to see his marriage-related concubine.

sentences.zh: 遂入，適伯姬氏。

translations.literal: They then entered and went to the Bo Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: They then entered and went to the Bo Ji residence.

sentences.zh: 既食，悝母杖戈而先，太子與五人介，輿猳從之。

translations.literal: Having eaten, Pei's mother held a ge spear and went first. The crown prince, with five armored men and carrying Xi, followed them.
translations.idiomatic: After the meal, Pei's mother led the way carrying a dagger-axe. The crown prince followed with five armored men, bearing Xi on a litter.

sentences.zh: 伯姬劫悝於廁，彊盟之，遂劫以登臺。

translations.literal: Bo Ji coerced Pei at the toilet and forced him to ally. They then coerced him to ascend the tower.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Ji ambushed Pei in the latrine, forced him to swear an oath of alliance, and then compelled him to ascend the tower.

sentences.zh: 欒甯將飲酒，炙未熟，聞亂，使告仲由。

translations.literal: Luan Ning was about to drink wine. The roast was not ripe when he heard of the chaos and had someone tell Zhong You.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Ning was about to drink wine—the meat was not yet cooked—when he heard of the disturbance and sent word to Zhong You.

sentences.zh: 召護駕乘車，行爵食炙，奉出公輒奔魯。

translations.literal: He summoned protection and harnessed the chariot. They circulated wine and drank roast, served Duke Chu Zhe who fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He summoned guards and prepared the chariot. They circulated wine cups and ate roasted meat while escorting Duke Chu Zhe in his flight to Lu.

sentences.zh: 仲由將入，遇子羔將出，曰：「門已閉矣。」

translations.literal: Zhong You about to enter, met Zi Gao about to exit, said: 'Gate already closed.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong You was about to enter when he met Zi Gao about to exit, who said: 'The gate is already closed.'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「吾姑至矣。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'I temporarily arrived.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'I have temporarily arrived.'

sentences.zh: 子羔曰：「不及，莫踐其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Gao said: 'Cannot make it, do not step into their difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gao said: 'You cannot make it. Do not step into their difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「食焉不辟其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Eat there not avoid their difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'I eat there and do not avoid their difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 子羔遂出。

translations.literal: Zi Gao then exited.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Gao then departed.

sentences.zh: 子路入，及門，公孫敢闔門，曰：「毋入為也！」

translations.literal: Zi Lu entered, reached gate, Gong Sun Gan closed gate, said: 'Do not enter to do it!'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu entered and reached the gate. Gong Sun Gan closed the gate and said: 'Do not enter to do it!'

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「是公孫也？

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Is this Gong Sun?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'Is this Gong Sun?'

sentences.zh: 求利而逃其難。

translations.literal: He seeks profit and flees their difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: He seeks personal gain while fleeing danger.

sentences.zh: 由不然，利其祿，必救其患。」

translations.literal: You not so, profit his salary, must save his calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: I am not like that. I profit from his salary and must save his calamity.'

sentences.zh: 有使者出，子路乃得入。

translations.literal: An envoy exited, and Zi Lu then obtained entry.
translations.idiomatic: An envoy came out, and Zi Lu was then able to enter.

sentences.zh: 曰：「太子焉用孔悝？

translations.literal: Said: 'Crown prince why use Kong Pei?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Why does the crown prince use Kong Pei?'

sentences.zh: 雖殺之，必或繼之。」

translations.literal: Though kill him, must someone succeed him.'
translations.idiomatic: Though we kill him, someone must succeed him.'

sentences.zh: 且曰：「太子無勇。

translations.literal: Moreover said: 'Crown prince without courage.
translations.idiomatic: He moreover said: 'The crown prince has no courage.

sentences.zh: 若燔臺，必舍孔叔。」

translations.literal: If burn tower, must abandon Kong Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: If we burn the tower, we must abandon Kong Shu.'

sentences.zh: 太子聞之，懼，下石乞、盂黶敵子路，以戈擊之，割纓。

translations.literal: The crown prince heard it and feared. He descended with Shi Qi and Yu Mi to oppose Zi Lu. They struck him with ge spears and cut his tassel.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince heard this and grew fearful. He came down with Shi Qi and Yu Mi to confront Zi Lu. They attacked him with dagger-axes and cut his helmet tassel.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「君子死，冠不免。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: 'Gentleman dies, cap not remove.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lu said: 'A gentleman dies with his cap not removed.'

sentences.zh: 結纓而死。

translations.literal: He tied his tassel and died.
translations.idiomatic: He tied up his tassel and died.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞衛亂，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Kong Qiu heard Wei chaos, said: 'Alas!'
translations.idiomatic: Kong Qiu heard of Wei's chaos and said: 'Alas!'

sentences.zh: 柴也其來乎？

translations.literal: Chai will come?'
translations.idiomatic: Will Chai come?'

sentences.zh: 由也其死矣。」

translations.literal: You will die.'
translations.idiomatic: You, sir, will surely die.'

sentences.zh: 孔悝竟立太子蒯聵，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Kong Pei finally established Crown Prince Kuai Kui, who became Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Pei finally installed Crown Prince Kuai Kui as ruler, who became Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公蒯聵者，出公父也，居外，怨大夫莫迎立。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang Kuai Kui was Duke Chu's father. He resided outside and resented that none of the grand officers welcomed and established him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang (Kuai Kui) was Duke Chu's father. Living in exile, he resented that none of the high ministers had welcomed him back and installed him as ruler.

sentences.zh: 元年即位，欲盡誅大臣，曰：「寡人居外久矣，子亦嘗聞之乎？」

translations.literal: First year ascended throne, desired completely execute ministers, said: 'I resided outside long, you also once heard it?'
translations.idiomatic: In his first year he ascended the throne and desired to completely execute the ministers, saying: 'I resided outside for a long time. Have you also once heard of it?'

sentences.zh: 群臣欲作亂，乃止。

translations.literal: The multitude of ministers desired to make rebellion, so he stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The assembled ministers wished to rebel, so he desisted.

sentences.zh: 二年，魯孔丘卒。

translations.literal: In the second year, Lu's Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Kong Qiu of Lu died.

sentences.zh: 三年，莊公上城，見戎州。

translations.literal: In the third year, Duke Zhuang ascended the city wall and saw Rong state.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Duke Zhuang climbed the city wall and looked toward Rong territory.

sentences.zh: 曰：「戎虜何為是？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Rong captives why here?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Why are Rong captives here?'

sentences.zh: 戎州病之。

translations.literal: Rong state was angered by it.
translations.idiomatic: The Rong were angered by this.

sentences.zh: 十月，戎州告趙簡子，簡子圍衛。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Rong state told Zhao Jian Zi, and Jian Zi surrounded Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, the Rong informed Zhao Jianzi, who then besieged Wei.

sentences.zh: 十一月，莊公出奔，衛人立公子斑師為衛君。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Duke Zhuang fled, and the Wei people established Prince Ban Shi as Wei's lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Duke Zhuang fled into exile, and the people of Wei installed Prince Banshi as their ruler.

sentences.zh: 齊伐衛，虜斑師，更立公子起為衛君。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Wei, captured Ban Shi, and changed to establish Prince Qi as Wei's lord.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Wei, captured Banshi, and installed Prince Qi as Wei's ruler instead.

sentences.zh: 衛君起元年，衛石曼尃逐其君起，起奔齊。

translations.literal: In Wei lord Qi's first year, Wei's Shi Man Duo expelled his lord Qi, and Qi fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Qi's first year as ruler of Wei, Shi Manduo expelled his lord Qi, who fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 衛出公輒自齊復歸立。

translations.literal: Wei Duke Chu Zhe from Qi again returned and was established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu Zhe returned from Qi and was restored to the Wei throne.

sentences.zh: 初，出公立十二年亡，亡在外四年復入。

translations.literal: Initially, Duke Chu ascended for twelve years and fled. He fled outside for four years and again entered.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Chu reigned for twelve years before going into exile. He remained in exile for four years before returning.

sentences.zh: 出公後元年，賞從亡者。

translations.literal: In Duke Chu's first year after returning, he rewarded those who had followed him in flight.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Chu's first year after his restoration, he rewarded those who had followed him into exile.

sentences.zh: 立二十一年卒，出公季父黔攻出公子而自立，是為悼公。

translations.literal: He ascended for twenty-one years and died. Duke Chu's younger uncle Qian attacked Duke Chu's son and self-established, becoming Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: He reigned for twenty-one years and died. Duke Chu's youngest uncle Qian attacked Duke Chu's son and usurped the throne, becoming Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公五年卒，子敬公弗立。

translations.literal: Duke Dao died in his fifth year, and his son Duke Jing Fu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao died in his fifth year, and his son Fu ascended as Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 敬公十九年卒，子昭公糾立。

translations.literal: Duke Jing died in his nineteenth year, and his son Duke Zhao Jiu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died in his nineteenth year, and his son Jiu ascended as Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 是時三晉彊，衛如小侯，屬之。

translations.literal: At this time the three Jin were strong. Wei was like a small hou and belonged to them.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the three Jin states were powerful. Wei was reduced to the status of a minor lord and became subordinate to them.

sentences.zh: 昭公六年，公子亹弒之代立，是為懷公。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhao's sixth year, Prince Wei assassinated him and replaced him, becoming Duke Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's sixth year, Prince Wei assassinated him and took his place, becoming Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公十一年，公子穨弒懷公而代立，是為慎公。

translations.literal: In Duke Huai's eleventh year, Prince Kui assassinated Duke Huai and replaced him, becoming Duke Shen.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huai's eleventh year, Prince Kui assassinated Duke Huai and usurped his position, becoming Duke Shen.

sentences.zh: 慎公父，公子適；

translations.literal: Shen Gong father, prince Di;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen's father was Prince Di;

sentences.zh: 適父，敬公也。

translations.literal: Di's father was Duke Jing.
translations.idiomatic: Di's father was Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 慎公四十二年卒，子聲公訓立。

translations.literal: Duke Shen died in his forty-second year, and his son Duke Sheng Xun ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Shen died in his forty-second year, and his son Xun ascended as Duke Sheng.

sentences.zh: 聲公十一年卒，子成侯遫立。

translations.literal: Duke Sheng died in his eleventh year, and his son Marquis Cheng Suo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Sheng died in his eleventh year, and his son Suo ascended as Marquis Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成侯十一年，公孫鞅入秦。

translations.literal: In Marquis Cheng's eleventh year, Gong Sun Yang entered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Marquis Cheng's eleventh year, Gongsun Yang entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，衛更貶號曰侯。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Wei changed and demoted its title to hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Wei's title was further demoted to hou.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，成侯卒，子平侯立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Marquis Cheng died, and his son Marquis Ping ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Marquis Cheng died, and his son ascended as Marquis Ping.

sentences.zh: 平侯八年卒，子嗣君立。

translations.literal: Marquis Ping died in his eighth year, and his son Lord Si ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Ping died in his eighth year, and his son ascended as Lord Si.

sentences.zh: 嗣君五年，更貶號曰君，獨有濮陽。

translations.literal: In Lord Si's fifth year, they changed and demoted the title to jun, and he alone had Pu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Si's fifth year, the title was further demoted to jun, and he retained only Puyang.

sentences.zh: 四十二年卒，子懷君立。

translations.literal: He died in the forty-second year, and his son Lord Huai ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the forty-second year, and his son ascended as Lord Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷君三十一年，朝魏，魏囚殺懷君。

translations.literal: In Lord Huai's thirty-first year, he paid court to Wei, and Wei imprisoned and killed Lord Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Huai's thirty-first year, he went to pay homage to Wei, but Wei imprisoned and executed him.

sentences.zh: 魏更立嗣君弟，是為元君。

translations.literal: Wei changed and established the heir lord's younger brother, who became Lord Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Wei installed Lord Si's younger brother instead, who became Lord Yuan.

sentences.zh: 元君為魏婿，故魏立之。

translations.literal: Lord Yuan was Wei's son-in-law, so Wei established him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Yuan was Wei's son-in-law, which is why Wei installed him.

sentences.zh: 元君十四年，秦拔魏東地，秦初置東郡，更徙衛野王縣，而并濮陽為東郡。

translations.literal: In Lord Yuan's fourteenth year, Qin seized Wei's eastern lands. Qin first established Dong commandery, changed and moved Wei's Ye Wang county, and combined Pu Yang as Dong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Yuan's fourteenth year, Qin captured Wei's eastern territories. Qin established Dong Commandery for the first time, relocated Wei's Yewang county, and incorporated Puyang into Dong Commandery.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，元君卒，子君角立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Lord Yuan died, and his son Lord Jiao ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Lord Yuan died, and his son Jiao ascended as lord.

sentences.zh: 君角九年，秦并天下，立為始皇帝。

translations.literal: In Lord Jiao's ninth year, Qin united the world and established the First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: In Lord Jiao's ninth year, Qin unified the empire and established the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，二世廢君角為庶人，衛絕祀。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, the Second Emperor demoted Lord Jiao to a commoner, and Wei's sacrifices ended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, the Second Emperor demoted Lord Jiao to commoner status, and Wei's ancestral sacrifices came to an end.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余讀世家言，至於宣公之太子以婦見誅，弟壽爭死以相讓，此與晉太子申生不敢明驪姬之過同，俱惡傷父之志。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I read hereditary houses speak, arrived at Xuan Gong crown prince because wife seen executed, younger brother Shou contended death to yield each other, this with Jin crown prince Shen Sheng dared not clarify Li Ji transgression same, both disliked injure father intention.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I read the hereditary houses' accounts and came to where Duke Xuan's crown prince was executed because of his wife. His younger brother Shou contended to die in order to yield to him. This was the same as Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng who dared not clarify Li Ji's transgressions. Both disliked injuring their father's intentions.

sentences.zh: 然卒死亡，何其悲也！

translations.literal: Yet finally died death, how sad!
translations.idiomatic: Yet they finally died. How sad!

sentences.zh: 或父子相殺，兄弟相滅，亦獨何哉？

translations.literal: Some father son mutually kill, brothers mutually extinguish, also only what?
translations.idiomatic: Some fathers and sons kill each other, brothers extinguish each other—what else?
